events.originalText: Mount Ontake in central Japan unexpectedly erupted, killing 63 people in the nation's deadliest eruption in more than 100 years.
events.subtitle: Mount Ontake
events.headline: Mount Ontake Eruption Kills 63 in Japan

events.originalText: The Taliban drove Afghan President Burhanuddin Rabbani out of Kabul, tortured and murdered former president Mohammad Najibullah, and established the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.
events.subtitle: Taliban
events.headline: Taliban Seizes Kabul, Murders Former President

events.originalText: Led by pro-democracy activist Aung San Suu Kyi (pictured), the political party National League for Democracy was founded in Burma.
events.subtitle: Aung San Suu Kyi
events.headline: Aung San Suu Kyi Found National League for Democracy in Burma

events.originalText: American software developer Richard Stallman announced plans for the Unix-like operating system GNU, the first free software developed by the GNU Project.
events.subtitle: Richard Stallman
events.headline: Richard Stallman Announces GNU Operating System

events.originalText: Iran–Iraq War: Iran broke the Iraqi siege of Abadan by Operation Samen-ol-A'emeh
events.subtitle: Iran–Iraq War
events.headline: Iran Breaks Iraqi Siege of Abadan in Iran-Iraq War

events.originalText: Two members of ETA political-military and three members of the Revolutionary Antifascist Patriotic Front, sentenced to death for murder, became the last people to be executed in Spain.
events.subtitle: ETA political-military
events.headline: Last Executions in Spain for Murder

events.originalText: The British Aircraft Corporation TSR-2, an advanced Cold War tactical strike and reconnaissance aircraft that was later cancelled, made its maiden flight.
events.subtitle: BAC TSR-2
events.headline: British Aircraft Corporation TSR-2 Maiden Flight

events.originalText: Members of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference unanimously selected Zeng Liansong's design for the flag of China.
events.subtitle: Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference
events.headline: Zeng Liansong's Flag Design Chosen for China

events.originalText: SS Patrick Henry, the first of 2,710 Liberty ships built during World War II by the United States, was launched.
events.subtitle: SS Patrick Henry
events.headline: SS Patrick Henry Launched During WWII

events.originalText: World War II: Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy and the Empire of Japan signed the Tripartite Pact in Berlin, officially forming a military alliance known as the Axis.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Axis Powers Form Military Alliance with Tripartite Pact

events.originalText: The Broadhurst Theatre opened in New York City with a performance of Misalliance by George Bernard Shaw.
events.subtitle: Broadhurst Theatre
events.headline: Broadhurst Theatre Opens in New York City

events.originalText: Lij Iyasu (pictured), the emperor-designate of Ethiopia, was deposed in favor of his aunt Zewditu.
events.subtitle: Lij Iyasu
events.headline: Lij Iyasu Deposed in Ethiopia

events.originalText: The first production Ford Model T, the car credited with initiating the mass use of automobiles in the United States, was completed at the Ford Piquette Avenue Plant in Detroit, Michigan.
events.subtitle: Ford Model T
events.headline: First Ford Model T Completed in Detroit

events.originalText: The Ellen Southard was wrecked in a storm at Liverpool, England; the U.S. Congress subsequently awarded 27 Gold Lifesaving Medals to the men who rescued her crew.
events.subtitle: Ellen Southard
events.headline: Ellen Southard Wrecked in Liverpool Storm

events.originalText: The paddle steamer SS Arctic sank after a collision with SS Vesta 50 miles (80 km) off the coast of Newfoundland, killing approximately 320 people.
events.subtitle: Paddle steamer
events.headline: SS Arctic Sinks, Killing 320 People

events.originalText: The British East India Company inaugurated the Horsburgh Lighthouse on the rocky outcrop of Pedra Branca, Singapore, which later became the subject of a territorial dispute.
events.subtitle: East India Company
events.headline: Horsburgh Lighthouse Inaugurated in Singapore

events.originalText: Locomotion No. 1 hauled the train on the opening day of the Stockton and Darlington Railway, the first public railway in the world to use steam locomotives.
events.subtitle: Locomotion No. 1
events.headline: Locomotion No. 1 Hauls First Public Railway Train

events.originalText: In a letter to the Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-Lettres in Paris, Jean-François Champollion announced his initial successes in deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphs on the Rosetta Stone (pictured).
events.subtitle: Lettre à M. Dacier
events.headline: Champollion Deciphers Egyptian Hieroglyphs on Rosetta Stone

events.originalText: The Treaty of Melno was signed, establishing the Prussian–Lithuanian border, which afterwards remained unchanged for about 500 years.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Melno
events.headline: Treaty of Melno Establishes Prussian-Lithuanian Border
